title: Jasprit Bumrah told to 'forget playing for India' as defining SCG moment sparked workload concerns - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah told to 'forget playing for India' as defining SCG moment sparked workload concerns

Publication Date: Jan 07, 2025 10:17 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

The article outlines Jasprit Bumrah's stellar performance in the Border-Gavaskar series despite injury concerns emerging from his heavy workload. He ended the series with 32 wickets and was named Player of the Series, but his absence in the final innings has raised alarms regarding his fitness and management.

  • Bumrah took 32 wickets in five matches, achieving three five-wicket hauls.
  • He bowled 151.2 overs in the series, with a peak of 53.2 overs in one match.
  • Concerns about workload management sparked debate in the cricketing community.
  • Former cricketer Balwinder Sandhu criticized the idea of workload management, encouraging players to focus on physical endurance.
"If a bowler can’t bowl 20 overs in an innings, he should forget about playing for India." - Balwinder Sandhu

This situation highlights the conflict between modern injury management practices in cricket and the traditional philosophies regarding player endurance.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah's Workload Concerns Emerge After SCG Test Performance

title: People forget what Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have achieved in the past: Yuvraj Singh - The Times of India
summary:
Yuvraj Singh Defends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli Amid Criticism

Publication Date: Not specified in the article. Source: Times of India

Former cricketer Yuvraj Singh spoke out in defense of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, expressing that people often forget their past achievements while criticizing their current performance. Amid India's recent loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, he emphasized their contributions to Indian cricket.

  • Yuvraj highlighted India's achievement of back-to-back victories in Australia.
  • Kohli struggled in the recent series, averaging 23.75 over eight innings.
  • Rohit opted out of a Test match due to his lean form, which Yuvraj called a sign of greatness.
  • He reminded fans of their significant victories and contributions in past tournaments.
“People forget what they have achieved in the past. They are two of the greatest cricketers of this time.” - Yuvraj Singh

Yuvraj concluded by emphasizing the importance of support for players during tough times, urging fans and the media to recognize their value beyond criticism.
newTitle: Yuvraj Singh Defends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli Amid Criticism

title: 'He could have been the difference': Ravi Shastri and Ricky Ponting question Mohammed Shami's absence for - The Times of India
summary:
Shastri and Ponting Critique Shami's Exclusion from BGT Squad

Publication Date: NEW DELHI
Source: Times of India

Former India coach Ravi Shastri and Australian cricketing legend Ricky Ponting expressed disappointment regarding the absence of Mohammed Shami from the squad for the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia. They believe his inclusion could have significantly changed the outcome of the series.

  • Shami was recovering from ankle surgery and showcased readiness through domestic red-ball cricket.
  • Swelling in his knee led the BCCI medical team to rule him out before the fourth Test.
  • Ravi Shastri criticized the clarity about Shami's fitness and suggested better communication regarding his condition.
  • Both Shastri and Ponting emphasized Shami’s potential impact on India’s bowling attack during crucial matches.
  • Shami is currently returning to form for the ICC Champions Trophy in February 2025.
“Why can't proper communication come out on where he stands? A player of his ability, I would have brought him to Australia.” - Ravi Shastri
“I was really surprised when he wasn't flown out even halfway through the series.” - Ricky Ponting

The absence of key players like Shami could have altered the series dynamics, indicating the importance of experienced bowlers in high-stakes matches.
newTitle: Shastri and Ponting Critique Shami's Exclusion from BGT Squad

title: Rohit Sharma’s 'I'm not going anywhere' remark gets ignored by BCCI ahead of SGM: 'He was looking for escape route...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
BCCI Ignores Rohit Sharma's Retirement Clarification Ahead of Meeting

Date: Jan 07, 2025 10:32 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

After India’s loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series, Rohit Sharma clarified that his recent comments regarding stepping out did not signal his retirement. However, the BCCI officials reportedly dismissed his remarks.

  • The BCCI Special General Meeting is scheduled, with discussions expected about Rohit's future in Test cricket.
  • Rohit scored only 31 runs in five innings during the tour of Australia, marking a troubling average.
  • His clarification to the media included the statement, “I am not going anywhere.”
  • According to sources within the BCCI, Rohit's comments did not significantly alter the board's perspective on his future.
  • Officials suggested that Rohit was looking for an escape route to the World Test Championship final.
“Rohit was waiting to see if India could find an escape route to the WTC final. Now, it’s really up to him whether to continue to fight for a spot.” – BCCI official

The discussion at the BCCI meeting will be crucial in determining the path forward for both Rohit and the Indian team as they navigate the upcoming Champions Trophy and beyond.
newTitle: BCCI Ignores Rohit Sharma's Retirement Clarification Ahead of Meeting

EXCLUSIVE | 'Workload management is bull****, created by Australians': Ex-India pacer on Jasprit Bumrah b - The Times of India
summary:
EXCLUSIVE | 'Workload management is bull****, created by Australians': Ex-India pacer on Jasprit Bumrah bowling 150-plus overs in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Published on: [Insert Date] | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the concerns regarding Jasprit Bumrah's heavy bowling load during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he bowled over 150 overs. Former Indian pacer Balwinder Sandhu critiques the concept of workload management in cricket.

  • Bumrah bowled 151.2 overs and took 32 wickets during the series.
  • Concerns were raised about his physical limits due to the workload.
  • Sandhu argues that workload management is a concept created by Australians and insists that bowlers should listen to their bodies.
  • He emphasizes that bowlers are capable of managing such workloads with proper conditioning.
"Workload management is bull****. These are Australian terms, created by Australians. I don’t agree with this at all," said Balwinder Sandhu.

The article highlights an ongoing debate in cricket regarding player workload and the expectations placed on bowlers in Test matches.
newTitle: Ex-India Pacer Critiques Workload Management in Cricket Amid Bumrah's Heavy Bowling Load

summary:

summary:

Source: Hindustan Times

Jasprit Bumrah concludes his stellar series with injury concerns emerging from his exhaustion during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Bumrah took a record 32 wickets in the Australia Test series.
  • Injured on Day 2 of the Sydney Test, unable to return.
  • Concerns raised about his workload after a crucial performance at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • Failed to recover fully from exertion as noted in training videos.
  • BCCI has not confirmed the degree of injury.
"The damage was done, even though it would not become evident for almost another week. India had cooked its golden goose," the report stated.

The future of Bumrah's participation in cricket remains uncertain pending further medical assessments.

title: First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Pakistan fought valiantly but ultimately lost to South Africa in the second Test at Cape Town, despite a remarkable 478 runs in the second innings while following on, led by captain Shan Masood's 145.

  • Pakistan set a record total of 478 while following on, the highest by a visiting team in South Africa in 136 years.
  • The previous record for the highest follow-on total was 372/7 by Australia in 1902.
  • Shan Masood's innings of 145 was pivotal along with significant contributions from Babar Azam (81) and other batsmen.
  • Despite the impressive total, South Africa chased down a target of 58 runs comfortably.
  • The win secured South Africa's top position in the World Test Championship table.
“It surpasses the previous best follow-on total of 372/7 set by Australia in Johannesburg in 1902.”

In conclusion, while Pakistan put up a historic performance, South Africa confirmed their dominance by clinching the series 2-0 and setting their sights on the upcoming World Test Championship final.
newTitle: Shan Masood Leads Pakistan to Historic Follow-On Record Against South Africa

title: "Shubman Gill is a highly overrated cricketer": Srikkanth attacks young player, names three new batters for selection - Crictoday
summary:
“Shubman Gill is a highly overrated cricketer”: Srikkanth attacks young player, names three new batters for selection

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

Shubman Gill faced criticism after a disappointing showing in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, underperforming compared to expectations set by a strong previous series.

  • Gill scored 13, 20, 1, 28, and 31 in the series, contributing to India's 1-3 loss.
  • Kris Srikkanth labeled Gill as overrated, questioning his continued selection over players like Suryakumar Yadav.
  • Srikkanth suggested that domestic performers Ruturaj Gaikwad and Sai Sudharsan should be considered over Gill.
  • Gill managed to survive selection due to rare performances, but Srikkanth emphasized the need for consistency in challenging conditions.
Kris Srikkanth: “Gill has managed to survive because he scores in one out of ten chances.”

The conversation around Gill's selection reflects broader discussions about player performance and meritocracy in the Indian cricket team.
newTitle: Srikkanth Critiques Shubman Gill's Performance and Selection

title: Manu Bhaker's net worth was Rs 60 lakh before Paris Olympic, now her net worth has jumped to Rs.... - India.com
summary:
Manu Bhaker's Net Worth Surge After Paris Olympics

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: India.com

New Delhi: Ace shooter Manu Bhaker made history at the 2024 Paris Olympics, winning two bronze medals and becoming the first Indian woman to achieve such a milestone in shooting. Her financial journey has also seen substantial growth.

Key Points:

  • As of 2024, Manu Bhaker’s net worth is estimated at Rs 12 crore, up from Rs 60 lakh before the Olympics.
  • Her earnings are largely derived from her shooting career and endorsements with brands like Nothing India and Performax.
  • Female athletes in India typically earn between Rs 8 lakh to Rs 30 lakh per endorsement.
  • Reports indicate her brand value to be around Rs 1.5 crore.

Early Investments:

  • Bhaker started her journey with an initial investment of Rs 1.5 lakh from her father.
  • Organizations like Olympic Gold Quest (OGQ) have supported her financially.
  • She received Rs 12,16,257 from the Sports Authority of India (SAI) under the Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS).
  • Financial support from the Annual Calendar for Training and Competition (ACTC) amounted to Rs 1,50,67,390.

This financial backing has greatly aided her training and competitive endeavors.

Conclusion:

Manu Bhaker's rise in net worth reflects not only her success as an athlete but also the growing recognition and support for female sports in India.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker's Net Worth Surge After Paris Olympics

Date: January 06, 2025

Source: News18

After Sunil Gavaskar expressed his disappointment at not being invited to join Allan Border in handing over the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Cricket Australia acknowledged the oversight.

  • Sunil Gavaskar was not invited to the trophy presentation for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Australia won the series against India 3-1, reclaiming the trophy.
  • Gavaskar expressed his desire to participate in the ceremony, stating that it is a representation of both nations.

title: Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report - News18
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 18:17 IST

Jasprit Bumrah has sustained back spasms during the fifth Test between India and Australia, leading to concerns about his participation in the upcoming series against England.

  • Bumrah is expected to miss the majority of the white-ball series against England.
  • The extent of his injury is currently unknown, and a decision will be made based on that.
  • If it's a Grade 1 injury, recovery may take two to three weeks; a Grade 2 injury could require up to six weeks; a Grade 3 injury might lead to a three-month absence.
  • India will host England for five T20Is starting January 22, followed by three ODIs.
"The fresh blow has renewed focus on Bumrah’s workload and the Indian team’s overdependence on him."

The severity of Bumrah's injury will determine if he misses the entire ODI series or can participate in at least one match before the Champions Trophy in February.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal Spotted With A Mystery Girl Amid Dhanashree Verma Divorce Rumours? Know Here - News18
Shan Masood 'baffled' by Hawkeye trajectory following lbw dismissal - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Shan Masood Questions Hawkeye Decision After LBW Dismissal

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Pakistan captain Shan Masood expressed confusion over a Hawkeye review that led to his lbw dismissal during the final day of the Cape Town Test against South Africa. Masood was struck on the pads by a delivery that he believed was an outswinger, yet Hawkeye indicated it had struck off-stump on the review.

Despite a strong innings of 145, Masood was dissatisfied with the decision-making process and Hawkeye's accuracy, stating that the technology misrepresented the ball's trajectory.

  • Masood was initially ruled not out by umpire Nitin Menon.
  • The decision was reversed after a review which showed the ball hitting off-stump.
  • Masood claimed the Hawkeye visuals did not match the real-time event, asserting the delivery was an outswinger.
  • He displayed visible frustration post-dismissal, questioning the reliability of the technology used.
"I certainly felt that technology didn't show the trajectory of how that ball was." - Shan Masood

The incident sparked discussions about technology's role in cricket and its accuracy in reflecting on-field events.
newTitle: Shan Masood Questions Hawkeye Decision After LBW Dismissal

title: South Africa register emphatic 10-wicket win over Pakistan in 2nd Test, win series 2-0 - Hindustan Times
summary:
South Africa Secures 10-Wicket Victory Over Pakistan in 2nd Test

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

South Africa achieved a comprehensive 10-wicket victory over Pakistan in the second Test, clinching the series 2-0 in Cape Town.

  • Pakistan, forced to follow-on, scored 478 all out after being 421 runs behind.
  • South Africa chased down a target of 58 runs with ease in just 7.1 overs.
  • David Bedingham remained not out on 44 from 30 balls.
  • Shan Masood led Pakistan's effort with 145 runs before being dismissed.
  • South Africa will face Australia in the Test championship final at Lord's in June.
“South Africa will go into the Test championship final against Australia at Lord's in June on the back of seven straight wins.”

This victory highlights South Africa's current dominance in Test cricket and their impressive form leading into the championship final.
newTitle: South Africa Secures 10-Wicket Victory Over Pakistan in 2nd Test
